member.summary: Base class for all components. A component is a group of Gwen controls that handles user input of them. Component can be (and should be) created using XML and that makes it easier to use and maintain than creating a new Gwen control.

member.name: P:Gwen.Xml.Component.View
member.summary: Get the view of the component. View is a group of child controls or components that implements the visual part of the component.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.Register``1(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Register a component. All components must be registerd before using them.
member.param: Optional name for component. By default the name is component type name.
Optional data used when creating a component instance.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.Unregister``1(System.String)
member.summary: Remove component registration. After this the component is not usable anymore from XML.
member.param: Optional name for component. By default the name is component type name.

Optional data for a component constructor.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.OnCreated
member.summary: Called when the view of the component is created. This is the right place to do initialization of the component because Gwen controls are created at this point.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.OnChildAdded(Gwen.Control.ControlBase)
member.summary: This function is called for every child control of the component. Child control in this context is a control that is defined in the XML as a child element of the component, not child controls that implement the component.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.GetControl``1(System.String)
member.summary: Get a child control or component of this component.
member.typeparam: Type of the control or component.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.GetControl(System.String)
member.summary: Get a child control or component of this component.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.HandleEvent(System.String,System.String,Gwen.Control.ControlBase,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Override this function if you want to handle all XML based events in the same function.
member.param: Element handler defined in the XML.
member.returns: True if the event was handled, false otherwise.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.GetValueType(System.String,System.Type@)
member.summary: Get the type of the property value. Override this function if you want to implement all properties in the same function.
member.param: Type of the property value. Return null if you want to handle string values from XML attributes by yourself without conversion.
member.returns: True if the property is a valid property, false otherwise.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.GetValue(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Get the value of the property. Override this function if you want to implement all property getters in the same function.
member.returns: True if the property value was succesfully evaluated, false otherwise.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Gwen.Xml.Component.SetValue(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Set the value of the property. Override this function if you want to implement all property setters in the same function. This is also used in the XML parser to set the property value if no dedicated property was found.
member.returns: True if the property value was succesfully set, false otherwise.
member.remarks: No need to call the base implementation. If you implement this, implement also .
